position.marginalia_text: { Tre hore d'oro. Ritratti: prologi: vale-mondo.

marginalia.translation: Three hours of gold. Portraits, prologues, farewells.

position.marginalia_text: Ritratti di diuersi prencipi, e personaggi illustri: di mano di Francesco
Quattro prologhi di quattro Comedie dell'Aretino. Col Vale-mondo di Gueuara. Lo specchio del mondo.

marginalia.translation: Portraits of various princes and illustrious men written by Francesco Guicciardini. Four prologues of four comedies by Pietro Aretino. With the farewell of Guevara. The mirror of the world. Little and good. 1582.

position.marginalia_text: Philomela eandem canit cantilenam; sed Canticum Canticorum.

marginalia.translation: Philomela sings the same tune, but the Song of Songs.

position.marginalia_text: Virum quae[r]o sublimatum: et Artem, Virtutemq[ue] multiplicatam spagyricè.

marginalia.translation: I seek an elevated man, as well as art and virtue multiplied alchemically.

position.marginalia_text: Plenus est Sententiaru[m], qui nouit 4. virtutes.

marginalia.translation: He who knows the four virtues is full of ways of thinking.
